titleStmt.title: Archibald P. Cochran to E. L. Van Winkle
CWG4329

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisville Octo 29th 1863
Hon E. S. Vanwinkle
Secy of State, Frankfort Ky
Dear Sir
In the absence of Gov Bramlette, to whom the enclosed is addressed I take the liberty of enclosing it to you

I am not personally acquainted with Mr Grant, but know from the representations made to me by his uncle Jno A M Allister of Philada (with whom I am well acquainted) that he is an honorable & high minded gentle man For myself I can refer to my brother in law James Speed Esq of this city
If the request be granted. The papers addressed to my care will reach their destination & I will at once, on knowledge of the amount remit the proper fees
